title_narrative: Building capacities for safeguarding living heritage and preparing nominations to the Lists of the 2003 Convention for the Safeguarding of the Intangible Cultural Heritage in Africa
description_narrative:
The Listing mechanisms of the Convention for the Safeguarding of the Intangible Cultural Heritage play an important role in enhancing the safeguarding, visibility and awareness of living heritage worldwide. However, after 20 years of implementing the Convention, the regional balance on the Lists remains a challenge, with the Africa Region still underrepresented.

This project therefore addresses the need to strengthen capacities and explore South-South cooperation among States Parties in Africa to carry out successful nomination processes, for ensuring a better representation on the Lists of the Convention. It follows a dual approach, comprising: i) an ambitious capacity-building programme in Africa for the preparation of nominations and promotion of regional cooperation (outcome 1), and ii) innovative spaces for enhancing more holistic frameworks for safeguarding intangible cultural heritage in the region, through the identification and promotion of synergies with other UNESCO conventions in policymaking (outcome 2).
